p: In France, the prevalence of anti-HEV antibodies in blood banks was 3.2%, which is similar to that of other industrialized countries. However, the HEV IgG prevalence among blood donors from Midi-Pyrénées, a province in southern France, is 52.5%, the maximum rate described in developed countries, implying that HEV is hyperendemic to Midi-Pyrénées [ 67]. Seroprevalence rates among Dutch blood donors is 20.6%; these high rates of HEV are perplexing investigators as Denmark is not located near an endemic region nor does it have explained risk factors responsible for the illness [ 68]. However, rates are considerably lower in Switzerland at 4.9%. The low seroprevalence may be due to differences in sensitivity of assay method used and the stringent laws regulating animal and meat imports in the country [ 69].
